class.javadoc:
A Basic L&F implementation of SliderUI.
Tom Santos
Whther or not sameLabelBaselines is up to date.
Whether or not all the entries in the labeltable have the same baseline.

Returns true if the user is dragging the slider.
true if the user is dragging the slider

method.comment: This figures out where the labels, ticks, track, and thumb are.

method.name: installDefaults
method.comment: use default if missing so that BasicSliderUI can be used in other

class.javadoc: Populates ComboBox's actions.

Returns an enum indicating how the baseline of the component changes as the size changes.
NullPointerException {@inheritDoc}
javax.swing.JComponent#getBaseline(int,int)
1.6

method.name: getBaselineResizeBehavior
method.comment: NOTE: BasicSpinner really provides for CENTER_OFFSET, but
the default min/pref size is smaller than it should be
so that getBaseline() doesn't implement the contract
for CENTER_OFFSET as defined in Component.

class.javadoc:
Returns true if all the labels from the label table have the same baseline.
true if all the labels from the label table have the same baseline
1.6

method.name: calculateThumbLocation
method.comment: If it's not on a tick, change the value
This is the fix for the bug #6401380

method.name: calculateTrackRect
method.comment: used to center sliders added using BorderLayout.CENTER (bug 4275631)

class.javadoc: Gets the height of the tick area for horizontal sliders and the width of the tick area for vertical sliders. BasicSliderUI uses the returned value to determine the tick area rectangle. If you want to give your ticks some room, make this larger than you need and paint your ticks away from the sides in paintTicks().

Returns the biggest value that has an entry in the label table.
biggest value that has an entry in the label table, or null.
1.6

Returns the smallest value that has an entry in the label table.
smallest value that has an entry in the label table, or null.
1.6

Returns the label that corresponds to the highest slider value in the label table.
JSlider#setLabelTable

Returns the label that corresponds to the lowest slider value in the label table.
JSlider#setLabelTable

method.name: paintLabels
method.comment: Register Slider as an image observer. It allows to catch notifications about

class.javadoc:
Called for every label in the label table. Used to draw the labels for horizontal sliders. The graphics have been translated to labelRect.y already.
JSlider#setLabelTable

Called for every label in the label table. Used to draw the labels for vertical sliders. The graphics have been translated to labelRect.x already.
JSlider#setLabelTable

This function is called when a mousePressed was detected in the track, not in the thumb. The default behavior is to scroll by block. You can override this method to stop it from scrolling or to add additional behavior.

Returns the y location for the specified value. No checking is done on the arguments. In particular if trackHeight is negative undefined results may occur. value the slider value to get the location for trackY y-origin of the track trackHeight the height of the track 1.6

Returns the value at the y position. If {@code yPos} is beyond the track at the the bottom or the top, this method sets the value to either the minimum or maximum value of the slider, depending on if the slider is inverted or not.

Returns the value at the x position. If {@code xPos} is beyond the track at the left or the right, this method sets the value to either the minimum or maximum value of the slider, depending on if the slider is inverted or not.

class.javadoc: Track mouse movements. This class should be treated as a "protected" inner class. Instantiate it only within subclasses of <Foo>.

If the mouse is pressed above the "thumb" component then reduce the scrollbars value by one page ("page up"), otherwise increase it by one page. If there is no thumb then page up if the mouse is in the upper half of the track.

method.name: mousePressed
method.comment: We should recalculate geometry just before
calculation of the thumb movement direction.
It is important for the case, when JSlider
is a cell editor in JTable. See 6348946.

class.javadoc: Set the models value to the position of the top/left of the thumb relative to the origin of the track.

class.javadoc:
As of Java 2 platform v1.3 this undocumented class is no longer used. The recommended approach to creating bindings is to use a combination of an ActionMap, to contain the action, and an InputMap to contain the mapping from KeyStroke to action description. The InputMap is is usually described in the LookAndFeel tables.

Please refer to the key bindings specification for further details.

This class should be treated as a "protected" inner class. Instantiate it only within subclasses of .
